<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning! </strong>We can’t be the only ones excited for this Sunday’s ridiculous lineup: the final round of the Masters, the <em>GOT </em>premiere, four NBA playoff games, four NHL playoff games, <em>Billions</em>, <em>Veep</em>, and <em>Barry</em>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">There’s only one way to start a day that epic:</strong> with Light Roast, our exclusive Sunday newsletter. Just get three coworkers to sign up for the Brew and we’ll send it to you in the AM. You might as well learn something as you sit on the couch all day.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RIDE-HAILING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/04/12/weekend-getaway-uber-s-ipo?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A Weekend Getaway with Uber's IPO
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Reading a company's S-1 is like going away with a special someone for the first time. You find out their major risks, detailed financials, and how much they hog the covers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Brew’s office morphed into an upstate B&B yesterday when Uber <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/uber-officially-files-for-initial-public-offering-2019-04-11?mod=hp_minor_pos19" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made its IPO docs public</a>. It <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/11/technology/uber-ipo-filing.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plans to list</a> on the NYSE under the ticker “UBER” next month.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What wasn’t totally new</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Uber has self-reported unaudited financials for a while now, so the <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-04-11/ride-hailing-giant-uber-files-for-u-s-initial-public-offering?srnd=premium" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">S-1 filing</a> was more about details and context than groundbreaking stats.<em> For good measure: </em></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In 2018, Uber reported an adjusted loss of $1.85 billion on revenue of $11.27 billion.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Compare that to a net loss of $4.03 billion on $7.93 billion in 2017 revenue.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Uber <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/04/11/uber-releases-s-1-filing-for-ipo.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">didn’t disclose</a> the valuation it’s seeking, but Wall Street whispers have suggested $100 billion is the magic number. It was last privately valued at $76 billion.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What we <em>did</em> learn:</h2>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Uber isn’t prepared to turn a profit anytime soon. </span><span><a href="https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1543151/000119312519103850/d647752ds1.htm?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">So it says</a></span><span>: “We expect our operating expenses to increase significantly...and we may not achieve profitability.”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Uber is burning through cash as it cuts prices and spends gobs on recruiting to “remain competitive in certain markets.”</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Uber’s <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/uber-discloses-ipo-filing-11555015305?mod=hp_lead_pos2" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">once-phenomenal growth</a> is slowing. But it’s also investing in ancillary businesses like food delivery, scooters, and driverless cars. And when it does go public in (what looks like) early May, it’ll probably be the biggest IPO since Alibaba in 2014.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTERTAINMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/04/12/think-disney-live-action-remake-disney?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Think of Disney+ as the Live-Action Remake of Disney
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Less cuddly, a little jarring, but...strategic.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At a 2+ hour investor meeting yesterday, the company <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/4/11/18306809/disney-plus-streaming-service-first-look-shows-movies-marvel-star-wars?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unveiled</a> Disney+, the cornerstone of its plan to reassert dominance over the entertainment kingdom.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The block-centric interface looks <a href="https://twitter.com/RobertIger/status/1116468755180036096?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>pretty </em>similar</a> to Netflix’s, but there's one crucial difference: It costs $6.99 a month, or $70 a year. Netflix's most popular plan costs $12.99.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The Disney+ lineup is the ultimate flex</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A </span><span><em>High School Musical</em></span><span> series to serve all your karaoke needs for years to come.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.theverge.com/2018/10/3/17934746/star-wars-jon-favreau-live-action-disney-show-the-mandalorian?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Mandalorian</em></a></span><span>, a live-action show set in the Star Wars universe. Its </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/11/business/media/disney-plus-streaming.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">huge budget</a></span><span> rivals that of early </span><span><em>Game of Thrones </em></span><span>seasons.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Two live-action projects from Marvel ft. Loki and Hawkeye.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>And we’re not sure what levels of nostalgia are healthy, but </span><span><em>Hannah Montana</em></span><span>, </span><span><em>Lizzie McGuire</em></span><span>, and at least 5,000 episodes of other Disney-branded classics will put that to the test.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, as Disney aggressively promotes its own streaming platform, it’ll shrink its presence on Netflix. As it does that, Disney stands to <a href="https://www.latimes.com/business/hollywood/la-fi-ct-disney-plus-investor-day-streaming-questions-201904010-story.html?cid=eml_dbm_20190411&utm_source=Sailthru&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=BYERS%20MARKET%202019.04.11&utm_term=Byers%20Market" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lose</a> about $150 million a year in licensing income.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Disney+ may have been announced on the West Coast, but the target audience was on Wall Street. Given Disney’s firepower, analysts have high hopes for the service. Pressure’s on to add subscribers when it arrives Nov. 12. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPACE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/04/12/10-10?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
10/10
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://media.giphy.com/media/lS79F2aoRT0dk5QOkA/giphy.gif" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=3&v=TXMGu2d8c8g" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>SpaceX</em></a></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It took one extra day, but SpaceX's Falcon Heavy successfully completed its first commercial mission last night. To add to the excitement, its rocket cores landed safely on earth as if they were Olympic synchronized divers.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">And that video <em>would</em> be #oddlysatisfying</strong></span><span>...but we know </span><span><em>exactly </em></span><span>why it’s satisfying: SpaceX </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/spacex-falcon-heavy-succeeds-launch-and-landing-5b13de37-ff38-4f22-9117-d828199a7c1f.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recovered</a></span><span> three rocket stages at once for the first time ever.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Not as satisfying, but something to build on: </strong>Israeli spacecraft Beresheet crashed as it attempted to land on the moon yesterday. “I think the achievement of getting to where we got is really tremendous. I think we can be proud,” <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/11/science/israel-moon-landing-beresheet.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> SpaceIL president Morris Kahn.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/04/12/jetblue-goes-transatlantic?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
JetBlue Goes Transatlantic
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://farm5.staticflickr.com/4763/38692381505_73033f3de5_b.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><a href="https://www.flickr.com/photos/tomasdelcoro/38692381505?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>Flickr</em></a></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The carrier announced plans this week to add “<a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/04/11/business/jetblue-london-flights/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">multiple daily flights</a>” to London from its major U.S. hubs in NYC and Boston. The routes won’t go airborne until 2021, but JetBlue promised “affordable fares.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Which are kind of its thing.</strong> JetBlue (+1.30%) is known for its low fares almost as much as it’s known for its array of take-whatever-you-want snacks.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Per JetBlue’s Joanna Geraghty, “The fares being charged today by airlines on these routes...are enough to </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/04/10/jetblue-finally-announces-plans-to-fly-to-london.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">make you blush</a></span><span>.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Your move, Delta, American, and United. </strong>JetBlue’s British invasion (a phrase we are required by law to include) could lead to even more international expansion. Amsterdam and Paris are already on the shortlist.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But there’s one big hurdle, </strong>and it’s not that emotional support falcon that just fell into the aisle. To make overseas service work, JetBlue needs <em>slots</em>, or permission from airport owners to land and takeoff. CEO Robin Hayes yesterday <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/jetblue-gears-up-to-vie-for-slots-at-european-airports-11554999897?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">urged regulators</a> to force incumbents to cede some of their slots in the name of healthy competition.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AGRICULTURE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/04/12/no-counting-dollars-ll-counting-farms?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
No More Counting Dollars, We'll Be Counting Farms
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The U.S. <a href="https://www.nass.usda.gov/Publications/AgCensus/2017/Full_Report/Volume_1,_Chapter_1_US/usv1.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Census of Agriculture</a>—820 loamy pages of glory released yesterday for the first time in five years—showed <a href="https://www.agdaily.com/insights/usda-releases-2017-census-of-agriculture-data/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">consolidation</a> is still the name of the farming game.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Numbers of quite large and quite small farms increased, saddling mid-sized operations with most of a record $427 billion in grower debt.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Today, the industry’s debt-to-income ratio is at its highest since the mid-1980s, </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-04-10/big-small-or-bust-the-hollowing-out-of-mid-sized-u-s-farms?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bloomberg reports</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The average farm size grew to 441 acres in 2017 from 434 acres in 2012.</strong> Ag Dept. economist Jim MacDonald (his dream job) said big farms have become scale machines, which lets them increase purchasing power and spread costs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And cost management is...critical. During the census period, ag incomes tumbled 22%. And the average amount of land on farms dipped 1.6%.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But what</strong> <strong style="color:#000">happened</strong> from ‘12-‘17 is continuing today. The demise of the farming middle class is exacerbated by the trade war with China, which has hamstrung buyers in a bumper crop year. (Don’t feel left out when listening to Nebraska radio: learn what a <a href="https://www.maximumyield.com/definition/3668/bumper-crop?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bumper crop</a> is.)  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">+ Where U.S. farms are located:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1555007380.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><a href="https://www.nass.usda.gov/Publications/AgCensus/2017/Online_Resources/Ag_Atlas_Maps/17-M207-RGBDot1-largetext.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>USDA</em></a></sup></p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
QUIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/04/12/quiz?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Cheaper than a chicken wrap at Augusta National. Binging <em>Game of Thrones </em>from the beginning (really enjoying this Ned character so far). Don’t even <strong style="color:#000"><em>think </em></strong>about snapping a photo, Katie Bouman. It’s the Brew’s weekly news quiz.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1. Who said this: </strong>“There is no doubt that the strength, stability, and resiliency of the financial system has been fundamentally improved over the course of the last ten years.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2. One of the largest health care fraud schemes </strong>in U.S. history was busted this week. What was the name of the operation?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">3. What casino game </strong>is represented by the color red in this chart?  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1555012284.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">4. What do the following acquisitions have in common?</strong></p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Intel acquired Mobileye for $15.3 billion in 2017.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Google bought Waze for nearly $1 billion in 2013.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>McDonald’s paid over $300 million for Dynamic Yield last month.</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">5. Fill in the blank: </strong>The Trump administration has canceled a deal that allowed the MLB to sign ________.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><strong style="color:#000"><em>Answers: </em></strong><em>1) JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon 2) Operation Brace Yourself 3) </em><em>Baccarat 4) The acquired companies are all Israeli 5) Cuban baseball players</em></sup></p>

style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nA Weekend Getaway with Uber's IPO\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eReading a company's S-1 is like going away with a special someone for the first time. You find out their major risks, detailed financials, and how much they hog the covers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Brew’s office morphed into an upstate B\u0026B yesterday when Uber \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/uber-officially-files-for-initial-public-offering-2019-04-11?mod=hp_minor_pos19\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emade its IPO docs public\u003c/a\u003e. It \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/11/technology/uber-ipo-filing.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplans to list\u003c/a\u003e on the NYSE under the ticker “UBER” next month.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat wasn’t totally new\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUber has self-reported unaudited financials for a while now, so the \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-04-11/ride-hailing-giant-uber-files-for-u-s-initial-public-offering?srnd=premium\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eS-1 filing\u003c/a\u003e was more about details and context than groundbreaking stats.\u003cem\u003e For good measure: \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn 2018, Uber reported an adjusted loss of $1.85 billion on revenue of $11.27 billion.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCompare that to a net loss of $4.03 billion on $7.93 billion in 2017 revenue.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUber \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/04/11/uber-releases-s-1-filing-for-ipo.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edidn’t disclose\u003c/a\u003e the valuation it’s seeking, but Wall Street whispers have suggested $100 billion is the magic number. It was last privately valued at $76 billion.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat we \u003cem\u003edid\u003c/em\u003e learn:\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eUber isn’t prepared to turn a profit anytime soon. \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1543151/000119312519103850/d647752ds1.htm?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eSo it says\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e: “We expect our operating expenses to increase significantly...and we may not achieve profitability.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUber is burning through cash as it cuts prices and spends gobs on recruiting to “remain competitive in certain markets.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eUber’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/uber-discloses-ipo-filing-11555015305?mod=hp_lead_pos2\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eonce-phenomenal growth\u003c/a\u003e is slowing. But it’s also investing in ancillary businesses like food delivery, scooters, and driverless cars. And when it does go public in (what looks like) early May, it’ll probably be the biggest IPO since Alibaba in 2014.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt a 2+ hour investor meeting yesterday, the company \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/4/11/18306809/disney-plus-streaming-service-first-look-shows-movies-marvel-star-wars?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" href=\"https://twitter.com/RobertIger/status/1116468755180036096?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003epretty \u003c/em\u003esimilar\u003c/a\u003e to Netflix’s, but there's one crucial difference: It costs $6.99 a month, or $70 a year. Netflix's most popular plan costs $12.99.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe Disney+ lineup is the ultimate flex\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eA \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eHigh School Musical\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e series to serve all your karaoke needs for years to come.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2018/10/3/17934746/star-wars-jon-favreau-live-action-disney-show-the-mandalorian?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eThe Mandalorian\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, a live-action show set in the Star Wars universe. Its \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/04/11/business/media/disney-plus-streaming.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehuge budget\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e rivals that of early \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eGame of Thrones \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eseasons.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTwo live-action projects from Marvel ft. Loki and Hawkeye.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAnd we’re not sure what levels of nostalgia are healthy, but \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eHannah Montana\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eLizzie McGuire\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, and at least 5,000 episodes of other Disney-branded classics will put that to the test.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, as Disney aggressively promotes its own streaming platform, it’ll shrink its presence on Netflix. As it does that, Disney stands to \u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/business/hollywood/la-fi-ct-disney-plus-investor-day-streaming-questions-201904010-story.html?cid=eml_dbm_20190411\u0026utm_source=Sailthru\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_campaign=BYERS%20MARKET%202019.04.11\u0026utm_term=Byers%20Market\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elose\u003c/a\u003e about $150 million a year in licensing income.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eDisney+ may have been announced on the West Coast, but the target audience was on Wall Street.
